metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7131 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ext/wddx/wddx.c in PHP before 5.6.25 and 7.x before 7.0.10 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed wddxPacket XML document that is mishandled in a wddx_deserialize call, as demonstrated by a tag that lacks a < (less than) character.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7131` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
libphp7.0-embed - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
php7.0 - 7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3

criterions.comment: php7.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.8-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
